1:
I will call out with my voice to God;\q I will call with my voice to God, and my God will hear me.


\q
2:
In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord;\q at night I stretched my hands out, and they would not become tired.
\q My soul refused to be comforted.
\q
3:
I thought of God as I groaned;\q I thought about him as I grew faint.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
4:
You held my eyes open;\q I was too troubled to speak.
\q
5:
I thought about the days of old,\q about times long past.


\q
6:
During the night I called to mind the song I once sang.\q I thought carefully
\q and tried to understand what had happened.
\q
7:
Will the Lord reject me forever?\q Will he never again show me favor?


\q
8:
Was his covenant faithfulness gone forever?\q Had his promise failed forever?
\q
9:
Had God forgotten to be gracious?\q Had his anger shut off his compassion?
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
10:
I said, "This is my sorrow:\q the changing of the right hand of the Most High toward us."


\q
11:
But I will call to mind your deeds, Yahweh;\q I will think about your wonderful deeds of old.
\q
12:
I will ponder all your deeds\q and will reflect on them.


\q
13:
Your way, God, is holy;\q what god compares to our great God?
\q
14:
You are the God who does wonders;\q you have revealed your strength among the peoples.
\q
15:
You gave your people victory by your great powerâ€”\q the descendants of Jacob and Joseph.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
19:
Your path went through the sea\q and your way through the surging waters,
\q but your footprints were not seen.
\q
20: You led your people like a flock\q by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
